errorPage.title: Something went wrong!

warning.description: This page should be removed in production. It's only for testing error handling during development.

models.title: AI Models
models.description: Configure models, provider API keys, and defaults.

envVar.label: Env var (server)
envVar.description: For server-side API keys, set environment variables like ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, OPENAI_API_KEY, etc. These are more secure than client-side keys and won't be exposed in the browser.

updates.title: Application Version
updates.updateReadyMessage: Version {version} is ready to install. The update will be applied when you restart the application.

updateChannel.title: Update Channel
updateChannel.description: Choose which type of updates you want to receive

stable.label: Stable
stable.description: Recommended for most users. Only receive stable, tested releases.

beta.label: Beta
beta.description: Get early access to new features. May contain minor bugs.

alpha.label: Alpha
alpha.description: Bleeding edge updates. May be unstable and contain bugs.

autoDownload.label: Automatically download updates
autoDownload.description: Download updates in the background when available

installOnQuit.label: Install updates on quit
installOnQuit.description: Automatically install downloaded updates when you quit the application

checkOnStartup.label: Check for updates on startup
checkOnStartup.description: Automatically check for new updates when the application starts

info.title: About Updates
info.description: Updates are delivered through the Tauri updater system. When an update is available, it will be downloaded and verified before installation. You can choose to install updates immediately or wait until you restart the application.

troubleshooting.networkCheckConnection: Check your internet connection and retry.
troubleshooting.networkProxy: If using a proxy/VPN, ensure it allows GitHub/NPM traffic.
troubleshooting.npmEnsureNode: Ensure Node.js and npm are installed and available in PATH.
troubleshooting.npmVerifyPackage: Verify the package name/version exists on npm.
troubleshooting.githubVerifyRepo: Verify the GitHub repository exists and is public or you have access.
troubleshooting.githubRateLimit: If rate limited, try again later or authenticate to GitHub.
troubleshooting.permissionsElevate: Try running the app with sufficient permissions.
troubleshooting.generalCheckLogs: Check logs for details and share with maintainers if the issue persists.
